content.description: This route begins on an obvious arete. Move up 25 feet through thin cracks to a small undercling roof. Head right into an obvious crack system, and top out near the tree.
content.protection: Standard trad rack.
content.location: It is at the far right end of the wall before the big boulder leading down to the river. This ascends an obvious southeast-facing arete.

content.description: This route begins on an obvious arete. Climb the arete using thin cracks for protection.
content.protection: Standard trad rack.
content.location: It is at the far end of The River Chamber on the right. This ascends an obvious southeast-facing arete.

content.description: This is a steep route primarily climbing on face holds.
content.protection:
Quickdraws.

Eds. Apparently, this is no longer a sport route.

content.description: Snuffleuffgus has easy climbing on bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection:
This is a bolted route to a two bolt anchor.

Eds. Apparently, this is no longer a sport route.
content.location: This is the third climb in from the left and starts on the right side of a chimney.

content.description: This is a right-trending crack.
content.protection: Standard rack.

content.description: Start on the right side of cliff. Traverse out left following a flake system through bulge and onto steep slab above, follow seam, and face climb to the top.
content.protection: 3 bolts (and an optional 0.5 cam and #7 nut).
content.location:
It is located about 75 yards downstream from

Route 4

and

Route 5

.

content.description: Face climb up seams to a bolt. Here step right to gain tips crack that widens to hands then back to tips and a bolted anchor.
content.protection: A singles rack 0-2" and 1 or 2 RPs or HBs.
content.location: This is on a 40', east-facing cliff on the right side of River Chamber down by the river.

content.description: Climb a left-facing flake to a tips crack and a bolted anchor.
content.protection: A singles rack to 1".
content.location: It is on a 40', east-facing wall on the right side of River Chamber down by the river.

content.description: Face climb up to a thin crack that widens to hands at the top. Build a gear anchor.
content.protection: A singles rack to 2".
content.location: It is on the right side of a West-facing cliff on the right side of River Chamber.

content.description: Climb up the center of the wall past a horizontal, clip a bolt, and ascends a few more horizontals to the top with a bolted anchor.
content.location: It is in the center of a West-facing wall on the right side of River Chamber.

content.description: Climb a thin crack up the left side of a cliff near an arete to a good rest, clip a bolt, and continue up past horizontals to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: A singles rack 0.2-2".
content.location: It is on a West-facing wall on the right side of River Chamber.

content.description: This is a steep route with a fixed draw. Climb face holds with a few thin cracks to supplement.
content.protection:
Quickdraws.

Per

Lee Jenkins

: the lead bolts have been chopped.

content.description: This follows a bunch of bolts going up the cliff to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: Draws.
content.location: This is on the East-facing cliff on the right side of River Chamber down by the river.

content.description:
This is a crack line with bolts

(now without hangers)

for new leaders.
content.protection:
#2, # 1, .5, .4 pink tricam and nuts

anchor is in good shape

content.description: This has 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. Traverse left across a face starting just left of an obvious hand crack.
content.protection: Bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is in the middle of the canyon. It is four climbs in from the left.

content.description: Kickapoo has three bolts & balancy moves.
content.protection: Bolts up to a double bolt anchor.
content.location: It is on the far left.

content.description: The crux is halfway through the climb, pulling through a small overhang.
content.protection: This is a bolted route to a two bolt anchor shared with Kickapoo . Eds. Apparently, this is no longer a sport route.
content.location: It is the second climb in from the left.

content.description: G-Hab is consistent, mostly-hands crack for 40 feet.
content.protection:
Standard trad rack for one pitch. There is a two bolt anchor up tp.

Per

Jeremy Anderson

: the route can be top-roped by stepping around the corner to the bolts.
content.location: This is the first unbolted route on the wall. There is a two bolt anchor up top. It is an obvious crack line.

content.description: This is an easy crack line.
content.protection: Standard trad rack.

content.description: This ascends a diagonal crack system that works its way into a small chimney. There are very poor feet to the left which makes for some creative footwork. The crux is about 20 feet up pulling into the final chimney section. The moves are fairly burly and make you feel like you are wrestling a bear. This route is harder than it looks. There is some loose rock, but with some more traffic, this could be a really sweet climb.
content.protection: Some hand-sized gear at the bottom and a #0.3 Camalot to protect the crux. Build a gear anchor to belay a second, and then walk off to climber's right back toward the trail.
content.location: It is to the immediate left of the trail as you head toward the main River Chamber area about halfway between parking and the actual chamber.
